pergamon-museum-1.title: Pergamon Museum
pergamon-museum-1.description: The Pergamon Museum is situated on the Museum Island in Berlin. The site was designed by Alfred Messel and Ludwig Hoffmann and was constructed in twenty years, from 1910 to 1930.

allianz-arena.title: Allianz Arena
allianz-arena.description: The Allianz Arena is a football stadium in the north of Munich, Bavaria, Germany. The two professional Munich football clubs FC Bayern Munich and TSV 1860 München have played their home games at the Allianz Arena since the start of the 2005–06 season.

westfalenstadion.title: Westfalenstadion
westfalenstadion.description: Westfalenstadion is an association football stadium in Dortmund, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. It is the home stadium of the Borussia Dortmund football team playing in the German Bundesliga.

olympic-stadium.title: Olympic Stadium
olympic-stadium.description: The Olympiastadion is a sports stadium in Berlin, Germany. There have been two stadia on the site: the present facility, and one that is called the Deutsches Stadion which was built for the aborted 1916 Summer Olympics.

veltins-arena-1.title: Veltins-Arena
veltins-arena-1.description: Veltins-Arena is a football stadium in Gelsenkirchen, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. It opened in 2001, as the new home ground for German Bundesliga club Schalke 04.

alte-nationalgalerie-1.title: Alte Nationalgalerie
alte-nationalgalerie-1.description: The Alte Nationalgalerie in Berlin is a gallery showing a collection of Neoclassical, Romantic, Biedermeier, Impressionist and early Modernist artwork, part of the Berlin National Gallery, which in turn is part of the Staatliche Museen zu Berlin.

commerzbank-arena-1.title: Commerzbank-Arena
commerzbank-arena-1.description: The Commerzbank-Arena is a sports stadium in Frankfurt, Hesse, Germany. Commonly known by its original name, Waldstadion, the stadium opened in 1925.

imtech-arena-1.title: Imtech Arena
imtech-arena-1.description: Volksparkstadion is a football stadium located in Bahrenfeld, Hamburg, Germany. It is the home ground of German Bundesliga club Hamburger SV and was one of the 12 stadia used in the 2006 Football World Cup, hosting four group games and a quarter-final.

fritz-walter-stadion-1.title: Fritz-Walter-Stadion
fritz-walter-stadion-1.description: The Fritz-Walter-Stadion is the home to the Bundesliga club 1. FC Kaiserslautern and is located in the city of Kaiserslautern, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany. It is also one of the stadia used in the 2006 World Cup.

rheinenergiestadion-1.title: RheinEnergieStadion
rheinenergiestadion-1.description: The RheinEnergieStadion is a football stadium in Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany. It was built on the site of the two previous Müngersdorfer stadiums. It is the home of the local Bundesliga team, 1. FC Köln.
